home.title: Empowering open-source Bitcoin builders in Brazil
home.subtitle: Bitcoin’s long-term success depends on a diverse, global community of open-source contributors — one that reflects the people who rely on it most.
home.about: Vinteum exists to help make that vision a reality. We’re a non-profit Bitcoin research and development center focused on supporting developers in Brazil. We train, mentor, and fund contributors to work on Bitcoin Core, the Lightning Network, and other critical infrastructure — growing a Bitcoin builder community from the ground up and creating a sustainable pipeline of open-source contributors for the future.

program.bdl-description: The Bitcoin Dev Launchpad is our flagship acceleration program for open-source contributors. Over 12 weeks, participants learn by doing, through hands-on projects and mentorship, followed by a six-month fellowship for top-performing participants.
program.fellowship-description: Our Fellowship Program supports early-career developers exploring their path in Bitcoin open-source. Fellows receive financial support, mentorship, and technical guidance for six months, with the goal of building skills, confidence, and a long-term roadmap for meaningful contributions to the ecosystem.
program.mastering-description: Our Mastering Seminars are weekly study groups based on the books Mastering Bitcoin and Mastering the Lightning Network (Antonopoulos, et al). Each session combines peer discussions, technical deep-dives, and Socratic questioning to help developers and enthusiasts deepen their understanding of Bitcoin from first principles.

footer.newsletter-subtitle: The latest news, articles, and resources, sent directly to your inbox.
footer.credits: Designed by Vitor. Coded by jaonoctus with love.
